diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute Pancreatitis, Crohn's Disease, Inflammatory Bowel Disease, Type II Diabetes Mellitus
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Patient presented with abdominal pain and vomiting, elevated lipase levels (1089), and imaging showed a mildly swollen pancreas without focal lesions, supporting the diagnosis of acute pancreatitis. The patient's history of Crohn's disease and Type II diabetes mellitus were also significant in the overall clinical picture.
